intro: Proselia, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating. They produce umbellate or cyme-like inflorescences with small, greenish or reddish flowers. Proselia species are generally herbaceous perennials that thrive in moist, shaded environments.
